image.altText: An image of a dead dolphin at Grange Beach.

props.synopsis: Dolphins, sea lions, sharks, rays and fish have all been sighted washed up dead on Adelaide's beaches as the impact of the algal bloom continues to be felt across the state.

title.children: 'Heartbreaking' algal bloom hits metropolitan Adelaide beaches

image.altText: Aerial photo of Port Neill Jetty taken by drone on June 26 2025.

props.synopsis: Historic jetties are causing financial headaches for councils as they hand back responsibility for their upkeep to the state government.

title.children: Coastal erosion costs cause uncertain future for beloved SA jetties

image.altText: Close up of a Fuji apple with a barcode sticker

props.synopsis: A South Australian plan to ban non-compostable labels on fresh produce has come unstuck with growers worried about higher costs for consumers during tough times.

title.children: Stickers on fruit might be annoying but there's a reason for them

image.altText: A man with brown hair smiles, he is wearing a black polo

props.synopsis: Electrician Stuart Campbell was struggling with heartache when a mate dragged him along to a Latin dance club. He loved it so much, he wore out his dancing shoes.

title.children: Tradie's unlikely journey to become a dance instructor

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Laws that allow the South Australian government to redevelop the North Adelaide Golf Course and move the LIV Golf tournament into the city pass parliament.Â

title.children: Golf redevelopment to go ahead after controversial laws pass SA parliament

image.altText: A close up selfie of a woman wearing a cap and headphones

props.synopsis: Former reality TV contestant Tamika Chesser, who has been charged with the murder of her partner, has appeared in court. SA Police say they are yet to locate some of the man's remains. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Beauty and the Geek contestant accused of murder, police search for missing remains

image.altText: An image of graffiti at Princes Park

props.synopsis: Carlton's training base and former home ground is vandalised, as the Blues take stock following a 50-point loss to Port Adelaide on Thursday night.

title.children: Carlton's spiritual home vandalised as Blues slump to 50-point loss

image.altText: Minister for Infrastructure and Transport Tom Koutsantonis unveils an advert on new rules around e-scooters

props.synopsis: Private e-scooters and other electronic mobility devices will be allowed on some public roads and footpaths in South Australia from next month, under strict rules.

title.children: Law change allows e-scooters to be used on roads and footpaths in SA

image.altText: Banded stilts in flight near Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: With Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre expecting its most significant fill in decades, hundreds of thousands of migratory birds are flocking to the inland oasis, but how they know the rare event is happening is an "enduring mystery".

title.children: How birds know when Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is full remains a mystery

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer has been suspended from duty after being arrested and charged with several offences including abuse of public office and stalking.

title.children: SA Police officer arrested and suspended, charged with stalking and assault

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The owner of the Port Pirie and Hobart smelters says its operations will "simply not survive" without taxpayer support to combat alleged market distortion from China.Â

title.children: Port Pirie, Hobart smelters 'cannot be viable' without government help

image.altText: An aerial photo shows a series of five dams surrounded by grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Despite a moratorium on building new dams in the Mount Lofty Ranges since 2013, landholders have built about 400 and enlarged about 300 without approval.

title.children: Satellite photos reveal hundreds of illegal dams in SA region

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's face looking into the camera with a neutral expression. She has long grey hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: A major hospital's infectious diseases unit will be moved across a main road, after the doctors' union lost an appeal to stop the relocation.Â

title.children: Concerns raised for HIV care after tribunal dismisses bid to halt infection unit move

image.altText: Ilotopie performers coated head to toe in pink photorapher from behind, feat their naked bottoms painted pink

props.synopsis: Thirty years after they were thrown into an Adelaide prison for public nudity, legendary French street artists Ilotopie returned to the scene of the crime â as nude, and as proud, as ever.

title.children: Naked street artists return 30 years after arrests

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood celebrates

props.synopsis: A stunning Josh Hazlewood spell of 4-5 in five overs has earned Australia victory inside three days of the first Test in Barbados.

title.children: Australia claims remarkable victory off the back of Hazlewood heroics

image.altText: Two women and a man walks down a plane aisle towards the exit as a flight attendant smiles

props.synopsis: The first group of Australians arrive home on a military-assisted flight from Israel as airlines continue to deal with challenges in the Middle East.

title.children: Australian's 26-hour airport wait to leave the Middle East

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A woman found not guilty by mental incompetence of stabbing her children has requested she be allowed supervised trips outside of a mental health facility.

title.children: Mother who stabbed two sons seeks release from mental health facility as fathers recall trauma

image.altText: Man smiling in front of Port Adelaide Football Club logo.

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide Football Club will conduct a formal governance review after it says concerns were raised regarding club director Warren Tredrea's online content.Â

title.children: Port launches review following concerns over Tredrea's online content

image.altText: A large pile of metal objects next to construction equipment and a man in a hard hat

props.synopsis: The NSW government has reaffirmed its plan for a state-of-the-art secondary school in the state's far west, allocating more than $55 million to rebuild Willyama High School after a mould outbreak.

title.children: Mouldy Broken Hill high school rebuild closer after state budget

image.altText: A jetty broken in half by waves and wind.

props.synopsis: Wild weather in SA has laid waste to infrastructure, caused roads to close and left residents without power.

title.children: Jetties destroyed, properties flooded as severe weather hits SA coast

image.altText: A phone screen displaying a ghost icon.

props.synopsis: A South Australian school has advised parents of a "large" Snapchat group in which images that could be used to "extort or exploit a young person" have been circulating.

title.children: High school warns year 8 parents about 'inappropriate' Snapchat group

image.altText: A man with a big black and grey beard stands with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: From online crusader to censured councillor, Big Rob's little fights have become big problems for a regional city still recovering from natural disasters.

title.children: Is this man Australia's most divisive local councillor?

image.altText: A woman and man pose for a photo while dancing at a wedding

props.synopsis: In 2016, Linda Moussa's parter died after a falling at a worksite, with negligence later pinned as a driving factor. After receiving a financial boost from the government, SafeWork NSW is hoping to hold employers accountable for breaking safety laws.

title.children: SafeWork NSW to 'hold more employers to account' after worksite deaths

image.altText: Mechelle Turvey and Stephen Cleal hug outside court.

props.synopsis: After three years, a national outcry, and the sentencing of her son's murderers, Mechelle Turvey is still a force for change.

title.children: It took years to sentence her son's killers. Mechelle Turvey knew the truth

image.altText: A Collingwood AFL player contests the ball alongside a West Coast opponent.

props.synopsis: Bottom-placed West Coast has turned up to play against premiership favourites Collingwood at Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Eagles in the hunt for upset win over ladder-leading Magpies

image.altText: Boy running hand along fence

props.synopsis: A 13-year-old boy was left languishing in a homeless shelter for months because of Tasmanian child protection department's "gross negligence", a family member says.

title.children: Family of 13yo left at homeless shelter for months worry he won't live past his childhood

image.altText: An illustration of a woman and child in front of a tiled background.

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a bag of frozen frogs.

image.altText: Two men hold aloft a red and white banner outside a court which reads 'MAGA justices are taking away our hard-won rights'

image.altText: Four people in orange high vis tops, blue pants and hard hats walk along a raised concrete walkway inside a concrete tunnel.

props.synopsis: A state government frontbencher has retreated from initial denials that the Metro Rail Tunnel won't be fully operational until 2026.

image.altText: Lauren Sanchez in a floral wedding dress and Jeff Bezos in a suit.

image.altText: People carrying white bags over their heads as they walk in front of a damaged building

props.synopsis: Israeli strike hits a street where witnesses said people were getting bags of flour from a Palestinian police unit that had confiscated the goods from looters.

title.children: Israel's military orders probe into possible war crimes after deaths near Gaza aid sites

image.altText: Capaldi throws up a peace sign and smiles on stage, wearing a white tee and black bomber jacket

props.synopsis: From Lewis Capaldi's emotional performance on the Pyramid Stage to Lorde's surprise album party, here's what happened at Glastonbury on Friday.
